issues.title: `Add 1 new site` when visiting ZeroExchange Meta
issues.body:
```
TypeError: mergerZites[Router.currentParams.topicaddress] is undefined
Stack trace:
manageMerger@http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N5jjcC3Vg7JF6aSngymT7cZo8aWx2rxsC/js/bundle.js:47278:4
n@http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N5jjcC3Vg7JF6aSngymT7cZo8aWx2rxsC/js/bundle.js:46354:1222
[107]</</</</e.prototype.$emit@http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N5jjcC3Vg7JF6aSngymT7cZo8aWx2rxsC/js/bundle.js:46354:62681
addMerger/</<@http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N5jjcC3Vg7JF6aSngymT7cZo8aWx2rxsC/js/bundle.js:46936:7
```

Lots of such errors. This results in `Add 1 new site?` opening every second.

issues.title: Cannot post a comment or an answer
issues.body:
Example: open [/zeroexchange.bit/?/1J29rTU6VTtJQXkBPZzTZPjogdGNpfcBkr/1MrESi8JYQqWEVbuRiGE8d41z29PmpT8GT/1514183561872](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroexchange.bit/?/1J29rTU6VTtJQXkBPZzTZPjogdGNpfcBkr/1MrESi8JYQqWEVbuRiGE8d41z29PmpT8GT/1514183561872).

Try to comment or post an answer. (hint: I get `you can modify only your own files` in console, so before turn off all those `this is my site` checkboxes)

issues.title: Different usernames shown when visiting different pages
issues.body:
Example: visit [zeroexchange.bit/?/1J29rTU6VTtJQXkBPZzTZPjogdGNpfcBkr/1CiFGk8MdmQAYacFejYdjUkQcN5jYmoDYh/1514496913600](/zeroexchange.bit/?/1J29rTU6VTtJQXkBPZzTZPjogdGNpfcBkr/1CiFGk8MdmQAYacFejYdjUkQcN5jYmoDYh/1514496913600). In header I see `ZeroNet > V0net > ...`.

When I click `V0net` and I am redirected [to this page](/zeroexchange.bit/?/1J29rTU6VTtJQXkBPZzTZPjogdGNpfcBkr/1CiFGk8MdmQAYacFejYdjUkQcN5jYmoDYh), header is `ZeroNet > v0net@cryptoid.bit`.

So on some pages ZeroID is shown and on some pages username.

issue_comments.body:
Sorry if `ZeroExchange seems broken` sounded rude.

Yep, this doesn't work on all topics.

I am getting `Uncaught (in promise) Forbidden, you can only modify your own files` in console. I am sure you can reproduce this too, if you turn off `This is my site` checkboxes on topic site and ZeroExchage.

If there will be more problems, I will give more info.

Welp, looks like I can comment now.

Also, you said that the checkbox does nothing. But it does - with it turned on, `fileWrite` can edit all files of the site, and if it is off, `fileWrite` can only edit owned files - e.g. you cannot change `js/all.js`.
